message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CYBER. 

The paper focuses on developing probabilistic language models to extract collective, topic-based perceptions from geotagged Twitter posts. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, which are commonly used in the sub-categories of social and information retrieval (cs.SOC, cs.IR) and computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper deals with analyzing social media data, which falls under the sub-category of social computing (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the application of the methodology to support power grid restoration following a storm, which could be relevant to the sub-category of cybersecurity (cs.CYBER).
